headline: CES 2026 was dominated by these 3 tech themes
summary: CES 2026 took place this week, where a number of tech companies announced new projects and unveiled new products, such as Nvidia's (NVDA) Alpamayo open-source model to train and improve autonomous driving programs, Qualcomm's (QCOM) Snapdragon X Plus 2 artificial intelligence (AI) chip for PCs, and more. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley outlines the top three themes from the event. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

raw.headline: CES 2026 was dominated by these 3 tech themes

Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley outlines the top three themes from the event. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Qualcomm Stock Falls After Downgrade. The Apple Supplier Has an iPhone Problem.
summary: Qualcomm  shares have had a strong start to the year but a decline in spending from longtime customer  Apple  could knock the chip maker off course, according to analysts at  Mizuho  Securities.  The firm downgraded Qualcomm stock to Neutral from Outperform and lowered its price target to $175 from $200 in a research note Friday.  A weak smartphone market, plus Apple manufacturing more components in-house, could weigh on the company over the next few years, Mizuho argued.

raw.headline: Qualcomm Stock Falls After Downgrade. The Apple Supplier Has an iPhone Problem.

The firm downgraded Qualcomm stock to Neutral from Outperform and lowered its price target to $175 from $200 in a research note Friday.  A weak smartphone market, plus Apple manufacturing more components in-house, could weigh on the company over the next few years, Mizuho argued.

headline: Why Analysts Are Rethinking The Story Behind Qualcomm (QCOM) After New AI And Android Developments
summary: Qualcomm’s fair value estimate has been nudged from about US$191.80 to about US$193.40, a small shift that reflects how research views are adjusting rather than swinging wildly. The modest changes to the discount rate and revenue growth assumptions sit against a backdrop of bullish commentary around premium Android and AI, tempered by caution on broader semiconductor sentiment and AI expectations. Stay tuned as we break down what is driving this evolving narrative and how you can keep on top...

headline: Qualcomm downgraded as handset headwinds grow: Mizuho
summary: Investing.com -- Qualcomm shares face new pressure, down around 1.4% premarket on Friday after Mizuho downgraded the stock to Neutral, citing mounting headwinds in the global handset market and the loss of Apple modem share.
